description: This course introduces students to the complex history of the U.S.-Mexico "borderlands" through
a two-week off-campus study program in the Arizona-Sonora border region. Students meet with
scholars, activists, and governmental officials to learn about the politics of immigration
specific to the area, as well as environmental and cultural issues particular to the region.
Students are expected to do a considerable amount of walking, including a day trip to Nogales,
Sonora and a mountain desert hike. Offered annually during interim. Apply through International
and Off-Campus Studies. Also counts toward race and ethnic studies concenteration. Prerequisite:
